availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Limbrake (Grant County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Louisa Oden Limbrake in Harrison County, Kentucky, on October 1, 1836. Father of Charles Limbrake, Huey Limbrake, Permelia Limbrake, Mary Limbrake, and William Limbrake. Resident of Grant County in 1840. Farmer in Grant County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a corporal from September 22, 1862 to May 13, 1863. Reported as deserted from Sumner County, Tennessee, on December 20, 1862. Discharged on account of disability on May 13, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 93.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 849.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0109.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film 000216896, p. 58.
